review.description: I am a vegetarian and am always very careful about not ordering meat.  I eat thai a lot and usually look for "vegetable dumplings" on the menu and am always VERY clear to order the veggie and not the dumplings filled with meat.  When I went to ghang I ordered the vegetable dumplings, but when I took a bite into them, it was clear that I was eating meat.  As a vegetarian, this was absolutely disgusting to me. I told the waitress that I ordered vegetable dumplings and she said incredibly rudely and angrily, "No you did not.  You ordered the Thai Dumplings."  The Thai dumplings have chicken and shrimp in them and I definitely did not order them as I didn't even recall seeing them on the menu since my brain is so used to scanning for the word vegetable.  I told her that I did order the veggie and she still said that I didn't and DID NOT APOLOGIZE.  She brought me the veggie dumplings, but still, I was SHOCKED that she was so RUDE to me and did not even say sorry.  I have never had a waiter or waitress say that I was wrong---what about "the customer is always right" rule?  Well, this time, I was absolutely right and I was incredibly disgusted by her response to me as well as the awful experience of eating those dumplings.  Vegetarians and anyone who does not want a rude waiter or waitress beware of this place.
review.author: Julie E.

review.description: I enjoy the food here very much. It's a great go to for family dining. The dishes are flavorful and the serving sizes are large. I usually go  in the afternoon so I have not experienced any issues regarding lack of attention or long waits. The lunch menu is a bargain! But, be warned, if you do not remember to specify that you are ordering from the lunch menu, they won't ask you. You will be charged for a regular entree, and not receive the extra items that would have been included otherwise.
review.author: Laura C.
